data.title: Should Arnon Milchan and his production company leave Disney?
data.meta_description: Following Disney's acquisition of 20th Century Fox (now 20th Century Studios), the production company whose films TCF/TCS distributed, Regency Enterprises...
data.text:
I also have another thought: Milchan (and his Regency company) could strike a new deal with The Walt Disney Company, but not only would he produce films released under the 20th Century Studios and Searchlight Pictures labels, but also under the Walt Disney Pictures label, allowing Regency to do some more family-oriented films, whether they would be an original film, an adaptation, or a live-action remake of an animated Disney classic. Perhaps Regency could also help produce a Marvel Studios feature, maybe a Daredevil reboot that's set in the Marvel Cinematic Universe.

I also have another thought: Milchan (and his Regency company) could strike a new deal with The Walt Disney Company, but not only would he produce films released under the 20th Century Studios and Searchlight Pictures labels, but also under the Walt Disney Pictures label, allowing Regency to do some more family-oriented films, whether they would be an original film, an adaptation, or a live-action remake of an animated Disney classic. Perhaps Regency could also help produce a Marvel Studios feature, maybe a Daredevil reboot that's set in the Marvel Cinematic Universe.

I think that would work, I mean, regency did work with disney with pretty woman though the touchstone name (although uncredited, the wikipedia places regency as a production company for it) and for the family films you mentioned, regency did some family films in the past like Alvin and the chipmunks and aliens in the attic
